title: Owen Farrell might not have been concussed, but there is little doubt the blow he suffered impacted his brain and senses
text:
In 2010 the All Blacks appointed a Rhodes Scholar named Ceri Evans to their “Mental Analysis and Leadership Group”. Evans’ work was based around the mental state the players wanted to be in – and avoid – during matches, and I could not help thinking of him when I watched Owen Farrell suffer that sickening hit from Tomas Lavanini in Tokyo yesterday.

The Perform under Pressure system Evans helped devise was coded Red Head/Blue Head, and it judged how you react to events during a match. If you are a Red Head then you are prone to emotional, and possibly reckless, responses. If you are...
